numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a difference in admission chances.
2. Some students have parents with a very high income rank.
3. Some students have parents with a low income rank.
4. A student with parents with a very high income rank has 7 times more chance to be admitted into an elite college than a student with parents with a low income rank.
5. I wonder about background factors of the parents' jobs.
6. I wonder if these background factors play a part in the admission of the students.
7. I wonder if the kind of job of a parent matters for the admission of the student.
8. I am a high school student.
9. My community includes high school students.
10. High school students prepare to enter college.
11. High school students prepare to pursue a career.
12. People of my age must take these details into consideration.
13. People of my age must be aware of their possibilities.
14. People of my age must take advantage of what they can.
16. The headline is: The Rich Take Over College Too?
